channel.description: Recent content in book on Geowarin

item.title: Chapter 1 - Setting up a Spring web application in no time
item.description: In the first chapter, you will learn how to bootstrap your application effectively and how to leverage spring boot to get started with spring MVC in a couple of minutes

item.title: Chapter 2 - Mastering the MVC Architecture
item.description: In the second chapter, we will design a twitter search engine, learning the principles of MVC and DDD along the way.

item.title: Chapter 3 - Handling forms and complex URL mapping
item.description: In this chapter, we will create a beautiful profile form with server and client side validation

item.title: Chapter 4 - File Upload and Error Handling
item.description: In this chapter, we will implement file upload and see how to handle errors in Spring MVC

item.title: Chapter 5 - Crafting a RESTful application
item.description: In this chapter, we will have a look a the principles of RESTful API and learn how to craft one using Spring MVC

item.title: Chapter 6 - Securing your application
item.description: In this chapter, we’ll learn how to secure our web application and also how to cope with the security challenges of modern, distributed web applications.

item.title: Chapter 7 - Leaving nothing to luck with unit and acceptance tests
item.description: In this chapter we will learn how to test our application with spring test and fluentlenium as well as with geb and spock.

item.title: Chapter 8 - Optimizing your requests
item.description: In this chapter we will be looking at different techniques to improve our application's performances using cache, gzipping, etags, async and websockets

item.title: Chapter 9 - Deploying to the cloud
item.description: In this chapter, we’ll take a tour of the different cloud providers, understand the challenges and benefits of a distributed architecture and we’ll deploy our web application on Heroku.
